result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon S Topel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Custody Credit worksheet

Cases 13CF440, 13CF450, 14CF108, 13CM202 & 13CM368 called together at 11:07 am 
Defendant Brandon S Topel in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

13CF440 & 14CF108: 
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Topel waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information
: Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement (13CF440)

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #2-13CF440, Count #1-14CF108 & Count #1-13CM202; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #3 & #4-13CF440, Counts #2, #3 & #4-14CF108 and Cases 13CF450 & 13CM368

14CF108-Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment, AODA treatment & medical reasons; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being & concurrent to 13CF440 & 13CM202
--10 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $268  + $250 DNA Surcharge = $518; due in $40 increments per month beginning 6/30/14 and on the last day of the month thereafter until 2/28/15 - then to be paid at the rate of $60 per month until paid in full; non-payment results in a 25 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

13CF440-Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 1 year in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment, AODA treatment & medical reasons; to commence concurrent to 14CF108 & 13CM202 and consecutive to any other sentence in being
--17 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $268  + $250 DNA Surcharge = $518; due in $40 increments per month beginning 6/30/14 and on the last day of the month thereafter until 2/28/15 - then to be paid at the rate of $60 per month paid in full; non-payment results in a 19 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

13CF440-Count #2, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment, AODA treatment & medical reasons; to commence concurrent to Count #1 and 14CF108 & 13CM202
--17 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; due in $50 increments per month beginning 6/30/14 and on the last day of the month thereafter until 2/28/15 - then to be paid at the rate of $60 per month paid in full; non-payment results in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

13CM202-Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment, AODA treatment & medical reasons; to commence concurrent to 13CF440 & 14CF108 and consecutive to any other sentence in being
--16 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443 + $33 summons fees = $476; due in $40 increments per month beginning 6/30/14 and on the last day of the month until 2/28/15 - then to be paid at the rate of $60 per month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 25 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

As to ALL COUNTS: Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

Felony Firearm/Voting Restrictions Warnings Given (13CF440 & 14CF108)
Def. Notices of hearing for the 5/2/14 Preliminary Hearing; Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed; Unable to Forward: Notice also sent C/O JESO
Amended Scheduling Notice
Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Conflict Review Worksheet
Scheduling Notice
Bond to cover 13CF440 13CM202 13CM368 14CF108 and 13CF450

Cases #13CF440, #13CF450, #13CM202, #13CM368, and #14CF108 called at 2:01 pm.  

Defendant Brandon S Topel in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.

Court reviews Conflict Review Worksheet. Court finds no conflict and signs the Conflict Review Worksheet. The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, that DA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Topel. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

INITIAL APPEARANCE CONDUCTED IN #14CF108 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB listed on the criminal complaint is correct. 
The Defendant provides his current address to the Court; 325 Bluff Street, Fort Atkinson

Court requires $2,500 CASH bond to cover cases #13CF440, #13CF450, #13CM202, #13CM368, with all their previous nonmentary conditions to remain the same and to cover case #14CF108; 
Conditions of Bond are:
-No contact with Trella Cole 
-No direct or indirect contact with Susan Vandre except through an attorney
-No presence at 217 S Water St, Fort Atkinson
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-No possession or ingestion of any controlled substance without a vaild prescription
-No presence at 217 S Water St. E, Fort Atkinson
-No presence at Susan Vandre's residence

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

Recess: 2:16 pm.

NEXT: 
Preliminary Hearing- 05-02-2014 at 8:30 am for Cases #13CF440 #13CF450 and #14CF108; schedule cases #13CM202 and #13CM368 for Status Conference on same date and time.
